title: Chubby Hubby
text:
Chubby Hubby or Aun Koh (born 1972) is a <a href="blog">blog</a>ger from <a href="Singapore">Singapore</a>. His blog consists of dining reviews, <a href="travel">travel</a>ling, <a href="wine">wine</a> and <a href="recipes">recipes</a> for <a href="baking">baking</a> and <a href="cooking">cooking</a>. It also consists of many <a href="photograph">photograph</a>s of the food, most being <a href="photo%20manipulation">digitally altered</a>. The blog earned reviews in the "<a href="The%20Guardian">Guardian</a>" and was nominated for the world's best urban food blog in the 2005 Urban Blogging Awards.
Biography.
Aun graduated from <a href="Columbia%20College%20%28New%20York%29">Columbia College</a> of <a href="Columbia%20University">Columbia University</a> in 1996.
Aun was mentioned in <a href="Prime%20Minister%20of%20Singapore">Prime Minister</a> <a href="Lee%20Hsien%20Loong">Lee Hsien Loong</a>'s <a href="National%20Day%20Rally">National Day Rally</a> speech in 2006, as an example of Singaporean blogs on the <a href="internet">internet</a>. Singapore <a href="newspaper">newspaper</a> "<a href="The%20Straits%20Times">The Straits Times</a>" has mentioned him several times in articles about the hottest blogs, blogs to watch and the most popular food blogs. He was interviewed by "<a href="Newsweek">Newsweek</a>" and mentioned in "<a href="The%20New%20York%20Times">The New York Times</a>," the "<a href="South%20China%20Morning%20Post">South China Morning Post</a>" and <a href="The%20Guardian">The Guardian</a>. Singaporean <a href="bank">bank</a> <a href="Oversea-Chinese%20Banking%20Corporation">OCBC</a> has a tie-up with Aun; he creates special promotions for OCBC credit card holders with his favorite restaurants and food suppliers, which he promotes via the blog.
Aun was invited to dine during the finale recording of Bravo Channels 8th Season's Top Chef competition 2010; which was held in Singapore; the shows first international finale location. Aun was not a judge but was a dinner guest.
Personal life.
Aun comes from a politically connected family in Singapore. His father is Professor <a href="Tommy%20Koh">Tommy Koh</a>, Ambassador-At-Large for the Singapore Government who served as Singapore's <a href="Permanent%20representative%20to%20the%20United%20Nations">Permanent representative to the United Nations</a> and <a href="Singaporean%20Ambassador%20to%20the%20United%20States">to the United States</a>, as well as the third president of the <a href="United%20Nations%20Convention%20on%20the%20Law%20of%20the%20Sea">United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea</a>.
